availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Gore (Bath County, Kentucky, farm hand and soldier)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farm hand and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Prudence Goodpaster Gore in Bath County, Kentucky, on December 6, 1854. Father of Abraham Gore, Mary Gore, Frances Gore, Cook Gore, and Sarah Gore. Farm hand in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry Infantry as wagoner from September 9, 1862, to September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 54.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 61A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273007, p. 64 (of microfilm), (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 253.
